## What is a Limit?

The value a function approaches as x approaches a value.

```
lim f(x) = L
xâ†’a

"As x gets arbitrarily close to a, f(x) gets arbitrarily close to L"
```

## Limit Notation

```
lim (2x + 3) = 2(4) + 3 = 11
xâ†’4
```

## Limit Laws

| Law | Expression |
|-----|------------|
| Sum | lim(f+g) = lim f + lim g |
| Product | lim(fÃ—g) = lim f Ã— lim g |
| Quotient | lim(f/g) = lim f / lim g |
| Power | lim(f^n) = (lim f)^n |

## Continuity

A function is continuous at a if:

1. f(a) exists

## Basic Derivative Rules

| Function | Derivative |

## Differentiation Rules

```

```

```

### Chain Rule
```

# Integrals âˆ«

## What is Integration?

The reverse of differentiation (antiderivative).

## Indefinite Integrals

```
âˆ« f(x) dx = F(x) + C

where F'(x) = f(x)
```

### Basic Integrals

| Function | Integral |
|----------|----------|
| x^n | x^(n+1)/(n+1) + C |
| 1/x | ln|x| + C |
| e^x | e^x + C |
| sin x | -cos x + C |
| cos x | sin x + C |

## Definite Integrals

```
âˆ«[a to b] f(x) dx = F(b) - F(a)
```

## What is a DE?

Equation involving derivatives.

```
dy/dx = 2x  (simple)
dy/dx = ky  (exponential growth)
```

## Order and Degree

| Term | Definition |
|------|------------|
| Order | Highest derivative |
| Degree | Power of highest derivative |

## Separable DEs

```
dy/dx = f(x)g(y)

Separate: dy/g(y) = f(x)dx
Integrate both sides
```
